Thrissur



Thrissur Pooram


Thrissur Pooram, often hailed as the "Mother of all Poorams," stands as one of the grandest and most iconic temple festivals in India. Celebrated annually at the Vadakkunnathan Temple in Thrissur, it brings together a spectacular display of cultural extravagance, vibrant processions, and electrifying fireworks.

The festival is renowned for the elaborate decorations on caparisoned elephants, traditional percussion ensembles, and the fervor of participating temples, making it a captivating and immersive cultural experience that attracts devotees and tourists alike.


Kerala Kalamandalam

Nestled in Cheruthuruthy near Thrissur, Kerala Kalamandalam is a revered institution dedicated to the preservation and promotion of traditional art forms. Established in 1930, it has played a pivotal role in nurturing talents in classical dance and music. The institution showcases the richness of Kerala's cultural heritage through performances, training programs, and exhibitions. Visitors to Kerala Kalamandalam can witness live performances of art forms like Kathakali, Mohiniyattam, and Bharatanatyam, gaining a profound understanding of the intricate beauty and significance of these traditional arts.

Cheruthuruthy Eco-Garden


The Cheruthuruthy Eco-Garden, located near Kerala Kalamandalam, offers a peaceful retreat in nature. This well-maintained garden features lush greenery, serene water bodies, and walking trails, providing a perfect escape from the bustling city life. Visitors can stroll through the eco-garden, enjoying the tranquility and appreciating the diverse flora.

The garden serves as an ideal spot for nature enthusiasts, photographers, and anyone seeking a quiet and rejuvenating environment in the lap of nature.
